page.title: 03A SHORT HISTORY_SKELMERSDALE
page.content:
Continued from page 2: The population grew rapidly from 760 in 1851 to 5699 by 1901.Unhappily, the seams were soon worked out and the area fell into decline again by 1950.
The biggest change in Skelmersdale's history came in 1960 when plans were announced to make the town the centre for Lancashire's first New Town.A Development Corporation was set up and huge amounts of money were made available. As a result of this new life was given to a nearly derelict area.
Here are some important dates in the latest history of the town: 1962- Development Corporation set up. 1964-Basic Plan approved. 1964-1st New House occupied. 1980-M58 Link opened.
